channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: React2Shell RCE Under Active Attack: Global Scramble to Patch Critical Flaw
item.description:
Headline: React2Shell RCE Under Active Attack: Global Scramble to Patch Critical Flaw

Summary:
A critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in React Server Components (RSC), dubbed "React2Shell" (CVE-2025-55182), is being actively and widely exploited in the wild. The flaw, which has a maximum CVSS score of 10.0, affects popular frameworks like Next.js and is being abused by multiple threat actors for reconnaissance, credential theft, and malware deployment. CISA has added the vulnerability to its KEV catalog, and researchers have observed post-exploitation activity including the deployment of web shells, cryptominers, and Cobalt Strike beacons. A Chinese state-linked initial access broker is among the groups leveraging the flaw, escalating the threat for unpatched organizations globally.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: A critical CVSS 10.0 RCE vulnerability, CVE-2025-55182 or "React2Shell," is being actively exploited in React Server Components, affecting Next.js and other frameworks. Learn about the threat, impact, and immediate mitigation steps.

Article Slug: widespread-exploitation-of-critical-react2shell-rce-vulnerability

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: DeadLock Ransomware Uses Vulnerable Baidu Driver to Blind EDRs
item.description:
Headline: DeadLock Ransomware Uses Vulnerable Baidu Driver to Blind EDRs

Summary:
A new DeadLock ransomware campaign is leveraging a novel "Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver" (BYOVD) loader to exploit a vulnerability (CVE-2024-51324) in a legitimate Baidu Antivirus driver, `BdApiUtil.sys`. This technique allows the threat actors to terminate any process, including endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus solutions, from the kernel level. By blinding security tools, the attackers can deploy the ransomware unimpeded. The attack chain, analyzed by Cisco Talos, also involves PowerShell scripts to disable Windows Defender and delete volume shadow copies, severely hindering detection and recovery efforts.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Learn how the DeadLock ransomware group is using a 'Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver' (BYOVD) technique with a Baidu AV driver (CVE-2024-51324) to disable EDR and antivirus software before encryption.

Article Slug: deadlock-ransomware-deploys-byovd-tactic-to-disable-edr

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Access Broker Storm-0249 Shifts to Advanced Stealth Tactics for Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
Headline: Access Broker Storm-0249 Shifts to Advanced Stealth Tactics for Ransomware Attacks

Summary:
The initial access broker (IAB) known as Storm-0249 is evolving from broad phishing campaigns to more precise, stealthy attacks designed to facilitate ransomware deployment. New analysis from ReliaQuest reveals the group is now using domain spoofing, DLL side-loading, and fileless PowerShell execution via a social engineering tactic called "ClickFix." This method tricks users into running malicious commands that download and execute malware in memory. These advanced TTPs allow the group to gain persistent, undetected access to networks, which it then sells to ransomware affiliates like LockBit and ALPHV, increasing the threat to organizations.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Ransomware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Initial Access Broker Storm-0249 is evolving its TTPs, using 'ClickFix' social engineering, fileless PowerShell, and DLL side-loading to facilitate ransomware attacks for affiliates.

Article Slug: iab-storm-0249-evolves-ttps-for-ransomware-deployment

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Code-to-Cloud Attacks: Leaked GitHub Tokens Become Keys to the Kingdom
item.description:
Headline: Code-to-Cloud Attacks: Leaked GitHub Tokens Become Keys to the Kingdom

Summary:
Security researchers at Wiz have detailed an emerging "code-to-cloud" attack vector where threat actors leverage compromised GitHub Personal Access Tokens (PATs) to pivot from code repositories directly into production cloud environments. By abusing the trust between GitHub and connected Cloud Service Providers (CSPs), attackers with even basic read permissions can discover secret names, then use write permissions to execute malicious GitHub Actions that exfiltrate CSP credentials. The attack is particularly stealthy as API calls to search for secret names are not logged by GitHub Enterprise, creating a major visibility gap for defenders.

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Supply Chain Attack, Vulnerability

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Discover the 'code-to-cloud' attack vector where threat actors use compromised GitHub Personal Access Tokens (PATs) to pivot into production cloud environments, exfiltrating secrets and gaining control.

Article Slug: code-to-cloud-attack-vector-abuses-github-pats

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New 'Broadside' Botnet Exploits DVRs to Target Maritime Logistics
item.description:
Headline: New 'Broadside' Botnet Exploits DVRs to Target Maritime Logistics

Summary:
A new, sophisticated variant of the Mirai botnet, dubbed "Broadside," is actively exploiting a command injection vulnerability (CVE-2024-3721) in TBK Digital Video Recorder (DVR) devices. According to research from Cydome, the campaign specifically targets the maritime logistics sector, where these DVRs are common. Broadside is more advanced than typical Mirai variants, using stealthier techniques and a custom C2 protocol. Crucially, its goals extend beyond DDoS to include credential harvesting and lateral movement, turning compromised DVRs into strategic footholds on vessel networks.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Industrial Control Systems, IoT Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new Mirai botnet variant named 'Broadside' is exploiting CVE-2024-3721 in TBK DVRs, specifically targeting the maritime sector for credential harvesting and lateral movement.

Article Slug: broadside-botnet-targets-maritime-sector-via-dvr-flaw

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: AI Threat Hunting Exposes 'GhostPenguin,' a Linux Backdoor Undetected for Months
item.description:
Headline: AI Threat Hunting Exposes 'GhostPenguin,' a Linux Backdoor Undetected for Months

Summary:
Researchers at Trend Micro have discovered "GhostPenguin," a sophisticated, multi-threaded Linux backdoor written in C++. The malware remained completely undetected on VirusTotal for over four months after its initial submission. It was ultimately found using an AI-driven automated threat hunting pipeline designed to analyze zero-detection samples. GhostPenguin provides attackers with full remote shell access and file system control over an RC5-encrypted UDP channel, using port 53 to masquerade as DNS traffic, highlighting the growing need for AI in detecting emerging, stealthy threats.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: An AI-driven threat hunting pipeline discovered 'GhostPenguin,' a stealthy Linux backdoor that remained undetected for months, using encrypted UDP for C2 communications.

Article Slug: ai-threat-hunting-uncovers-ghostpenguin-linux-backdoor

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Vishing Attackers Impersonate IT on Teams, Trick Users into Running Fileless Malware
item.description:
Headline: Vishing Attackers Impersonate IT on Teams, Trick Users into Running Fileless Malware

Summary:
A sophisticated vishing (voice phishing) campaign is abusing trusted enterprise tools to deploy stealthy malware. Attackers impersonate IT support staff on Microsoft Teams, convincing users to initiate a Windows Quick Assist session. Once they have remote access, the attackers direct the user to a malicious site to download a loader. This loader then fetches an encrypted payload and executes it directly in memory using .NET reflection, a fileless technique designed to evade traditional antivirus and endpoint detection solutions. The campaign highlights the increasing trend of blending social engineering with the abuse of legitimate software.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new vishing campaign uses Microsoft Teams and Windows Quick Assist for social engineering, leading to the deployment of fileless .NET malware that executes in memory.

Article Slug: vishing-campaign-abuses-microsoft-teams-and-quickassist

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Akira Ransomware Blamed for Breach at Financial Software Vendor, 74 Banks Affected
item.description:
Headline: Akira Ransomware Blamed for Breach at Financial Software Vendor, 74 Banks Affected

Summary:
Financial software provider Marquis Software Solutions has disclosed a significant data breach that impacted over 74 of its client banks and credit unions, exposing the personal and financial data of at least 400,000 customers. The Akira ransomware gang is believed to be responsible for the attack. The threat actors reportedly gained initial access by exploiting vulnerabilities in the company's SonicWall firewalls. The compromised data includes highly sensitive information such as Social Security numbers and financial account details, making this a severe supply chain incident for the affected financial institutions.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Akira ransomware gang is suspected in a major data breach at Marquis Software Solutions, which affected over 74 banks and exposed the data of 400,000+ customers after exploiting SonicWall firewall vulnerabilities.

Article Slug: akira-ransomware-implicated-in-marquis-software-breach

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: IBM Rolls Out Critical Patches for AIX, Cloud Pak, and Other Enterprise Software
item.description:
Headline: IBM Rolls Out Critical Patches for AIX, Cloud Pak, and Other Enterprise Software

Summary:
IBM has released a wave of security updates addressing vulnerabilities in numerous enterprise products, prompting an advisory from the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security. The bulletins, published between December 1 and December 7, 2025, include critical patches for IBM AIX, VIOS, Aspera Shares, Business Automation Workflow, and Cloud Pak System, among others. Administrators are strongly urged to review the advisories and apply the necessary updates promptly to protect their infrastructure from potential exploitation.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: IBM releases critical security patches for a wide range of enterprise products, including AIX, Aspera Shares, and Cloud Pak System. Administrators are advised to apply updates immediately.

Article Slug: ibm-issues-critical-security-updates-for-enterprise-products

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Race for Secure Digital Identity Heats Up with New Platforms from IBM and Turing Space
item.description:
Headline: Race for Secure Digital Identity Heats Up with New Platforms from IBM and Turing Space

Summary:
The digital identity space is seeing rapid innovation as IBM launches "Verify Digital Credentials," a new platform for issuing and authenticating secure digital documents like licenses and academic records. Built on open standards, it aims to reduce breach risk by decentralizing data storage. Concurrently, decentralized identity provider Turing Space is partnering with the IOTA blockchain to enhance its own verification offering, aiming to lower costs for enterprise-scale deployment. These moves highlight an industry-wide push towards verifiable credentials as a foundational defense against the growing threat of AI-powered deepfakes and identity fraud.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: IBM and Turing Space are advancing the field of digital identity with new platforms for verifiable credentials, aiming to enhance security and combat threats from AI and deepfakes.

Article Slug: ibm-and-turing-space-advance-digital-identity-solutions

Published Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Supply Chain Attack: Marquis Software Breach Hits 74 Banks, Akira Ransomware Suspected
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Attack: Marquis Software Breach Hits 74 Banks, Akira Ransomware Suspected

Summary:
Marquis Software Solutions, a U.S.-based financial software provider, has suffered a major data breach, compromising the sensitive information of over 400,000 customers across 74 client banks and credit unions. This significant supply chain attack is suspected to be the work of the Akira ransomware gang. According to investigators, the threat actors likely gained initial access by exploiting vulnerabilities in SonicWall firewall devices on Marquis's network. This incident highlights the cascading risk in the financial sector, where a compromise at a single software vendor can have widespread consequences for numerous downstream institutions and their customers.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Financial software provider Marquis Software Solutions suffers a major data breach affecting 74 banks and credit unions. The Akira ransomware gang is suspected of exploiting SonicWall vulnerabilities in the attack.

Article Slug: marquis-software-breach-exposes-data-from-74-banks-and-credit-unions

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 09 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

item.title: NEW: React2Shell Nightmare: CVSS 10.0 Flaw Under Mass Exploitation, CISA Issues Emergency Directive
item.description:
Headline: React2Shell Nightmare: CVSS 10.0 Flaw Under Mass Exploitation, CISA Issues Emergency Directive

Summary:
A critical remote code execution vulnerability with a CVSS score of 10.0, dubbed 'React2Shell' and tracked as CVE-2025-55182, is being actively and widely exploited. The flaw resides in the React Server Components (RSC) 'Flight' protocol and allows unauthenticated attackers to take complete control of vulnerable servers. Within hours of its public disclosure on December 3, 2025, China-nexus threat actors, including Earth Lamia and Jackpot Panda, began mass scanning and exploitation. The vulnerability affects React 19.x and popular frameworks like Next.js 15.x/16.x. In response to the widespread attacks, CISA has added CVE-2025-55182 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating immediate patching for federal agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A critical 10.0 CVSS RCE vulnerability, React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182), is being mass-exploited in React and Next.js applications. Learn about the threat, IOCs, and mitigation steps.

Article Slug: react2shell-critical-rce-flaw-mass-exploited-by-chinese-apts

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Android Under Attack: Google Patches Two Actively Exploited Zero-Days in Massive December Update
item.description:
Headline: Android Under Attack: Google Patches Two Actively Exploited Zero-Days in Massive December Update

Summary:
Google has released its December 2025 Android Security Bulletin, patching 107 security flaws, including two high-severity zero-day vulnerabilities that are being actively exploited in limited, targeted attacks. The zero-days, CVE-2025-48633 (information disclosure) and CVE-2025-48572 (privilege escalation), both reside in the Android Framework. CISA has promptly added both vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, requiring federal agencies to patch by December 23, 2025. The update also fixes seven critical-severity bugs, one of which could lead to remote denial-of-service. Android users are urged to apply the update as soon as it becomes available from their device manufacturer.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Mobile Security, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Google's December 2025 Android update patches 107 vulnerabilities, including two actively exploited zero-days (CVE-2025-48633, CVE-2025-48572) added to CISA's KEV catalog. Update your device now.

Article Slug: android-patches-two-actively-exploited-zero-days-in-december-update

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: FinCEN: Ransomware Payments Skyrocket Past $2.1 Billion, Bitcoin Remains King
item.description:
Headline: FinCEN: Ransomware Payments Skyrocket Past $2.1 Billion, Bitcoin Remains King

Summary:
A new report from the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) indicates that ransomware payments reported under the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) totaled more than $2.1 billion between January 2022 and December 2024. The analysis shows a significant peak in 2023, with $1.1 billion paid across 1,512 incidents. Despite law enforcement actions against major groups like ALPHV/BlackCat and LockBit, activity remained high in 2024. Bitcoin was the payment method in 97% of cases, with the manufacturing, financial services, and healthcare sectors being the most frequent targets. The report underscores the persistent and lucrative nature of the ransomware ecosystem.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A FinCEN report details over $2.1 billion in ransomware payments from 2022-2024, with a peak of $1.1 billion in 2023. Bitcoin dominates as the payment method, and top targets include manufacturing and healthcare.

Article Slug: fincen-report-ransomware-payments-top-2-1-billion-since-2022

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix
item.description:
Headline: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix

Summary:
The University of Pennsylvania and the University of Phoenix have both reported data breaches resulting from the exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities in their Oracle E-Business Suite servers. The attacks have compromised the personal information of at least 1,488 individuals at UPenn and a much larger, unspecified number of students, alumni, and staff at the University of Phoenix. Security researchers suspect the notorious Cl0p ransomware gang is behind the campaign, continuing their pattern of exploiting vulnerabilities in widely used enterprise software for large-scale data theft and extortion. Both institutions are currently notifying affected individuals.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Cl0p ransomware gang is suspected of exploiting Oracle E-Business Suite zero-day vulnerabilities to breach the University of Pennsylvania and University of Phoenix, compromising sensitive personal data.

Article Slug: clop-suspected-in-oracle-zero-day-attacks-on-upenn-and-university-of-phoenix

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Chinese APTs Deploy 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor to Infiltrate VMware Environments
item.description:
Headline: Chinese APTs Deploy 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor to Infiltrate VMware Environments

Summary:
A joint advisory from U.S. and Canadian cybersecurity agencies has exposed a sophisticated backdoor named 'BRICKSTORM,' which is being used by Chinese state-affiliated hackers to target VMware vSphere environments. The malware is part of a long-running espionage campaign tracked as 'Salt Typhoon' and provides attackers with stealthy, long-term persistence. BRICKSTORM's capabilities include creating hidden virtual machines, stealing credentials by snapshotting active VMs, and evading detection. The campaign has primarily targeted government and IT sector organizations, demonstrating the adversary's deep expertise in virtualized infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A joint U.S. and Canadian advisory details BRICKSTORM, a new backdoor used by Chinese hackers (Salt Typhoon) to attack VMware vSphere for long-term espionage, credential theft, and persistence.

Article Slug: china-linked-hackers-use-stealthy-brickstorm-backdoor-in-vmware-attacks

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New Android Banking Trojan 'Albiriox' Targets 400+ Finance Apps via MaaS Model
item.description:
Headline: New Android Banking Trojan 'Albiriox' Targets 400+ Finance Apps via MaaS Model

Summary:
A new, highly sophisticated Android banking trojan named 'Albiriox' has been discovered by security researchers. It is being sold on a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) basis, enabling widespread distribution by various cybercriminals. The malware is designed to target over 400 distinct financial and cryptocurrency applications worldwide. Albiriox employs advanced techniques to commit on-device fraud, including abusing Android's accessibility services, using VNC for full remote device control, and deploying dynamic overlay attacks to steal credentials. A notable feature is its 'black-screen masking' capability, which conceals the attacker's remote actions from the user, allowing them to perform fraudulent transactions undetected.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have discovered Albiriox, a new Android banking trojan sold as Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) that targets over 400 financial apps using VNC, overlays, and black-screen masking.

Article Slug: albiriox-new-android-banking-trojan-sold-as-maas

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: White House Sets 2025 Deadline for Post-Quantum Crypto Readiness
item.description:
Headline: White House Sets 2025 Deadline for Post-Quantum Crypto Readiness

Summary:
The White House has issued a new Executive Order to accelerate the U.S. federal government's transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC). The order sets a critical deadline of December 1, 2025, for several key initiatives. It directs CISA and the NSA to create and maintain a list of commercially available products that support PQC standards, guiding federal procurement. It also mandates the development of new requirements for federal agencies to support TLS 1.3, a necessary precursor for PQC integration. Additionally, NIST is tasked with updating its Secure Software Development Framework (SSDF) to include practices for developing quantum-resistant software.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new White House Executive Order sets a December 1, 2025 deadline for key federal actions on post-quantum cryptography (PQC), including a list of PQC-ready products and TLS 1.3 support.

Article Slug: white-house-eo-sets-new-deadlines-for-post-quantum-crypto-transition

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign
item.description:
Headline: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign

Summary:
A new malware campaign, tracked as STAC3150, is targeting banking users in Brazil by using WhatsApp Web as a distribution vector for the Astaroth banking trojan. The attack begins with a social engineering lure sent via WhatsApp, which persuades the victim to download a malicious ZIP archive. The archive contains a VBS or HTA file that, when executed, initiates a multi-stage infection process to deploy the Astaroth trojan. Astaroth is a well-known information stealer designed to capture banking credentials and other sensitive data. This campaign highlights the increasing use of popular messaging platforms for malware delivery.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A malware campaign in Brazil, tracked as STAC3150, is using a WhatsApp worm to spread the Astaroth banking trojan, tricking users into executing malicious VBS and HTA files.

Article Slug: astaroth-banking-trojan-spreads-via-whatsapp-worm-in-brazil

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: SharePoint Flaw Chain Exploited to Deploy Warlock Ransomware
item.description:
Headline: SharePoint Flaw Chain Exploited to Deploy Warlock Ransomware

Summary:
A new attack campaign attributed to the threat actor Storm-2603 is exploiting a chain of Microsoft SharePoint vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704) for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deploy Velociraptor, a legitimate digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, for reconnaissance and persistence. By abusing a trusted tool, the attackers blend in with normal administrative activity, evading detection. In several confirmed incidents, this attack chain culminates in the deployment of the Warlock ransomware. This 'living-off-the-land' technique highlights a sophisticated approach to facilitating ransomware attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Vulnerability, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Threat actor Storm-2603 is exploiting SharePoint vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704) and abusing the Velociraptor DFIR tool to deploy Warlock ransomware.

Article Slug: sharepoint-flaws-chained-to-deliver-warlock-ransomware

Published Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Supply Chain Breach at Vendor Marquis Exposes Data From Dozens of US Banks
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Breach at Vendor Marquis Exposes Data From Dozens of US Banks

Summary:
A ransomware attack on Marquis Software Solutions, a marketing and data analytics vendor for the financial industry, has resulted in a significant supply chain data breach affecting dozens of U.S. banks and credit unions. Marquis began notifying its clients on November 26, 2025, about the incident, which was first detected in August. The breach exposed highly sensitive customer information, including names, Social Security numbers, taxpayer IDs, and financial account details, that the financial institutions had entrusted to the vendor. While the banks' internal systems were not compromised, the incident highlights the profound risks associated with third-party vendors. At least 42,000 individuals in Maine alone have been affected, and Marquis is offering credit monitoring services to impacted customers.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A ransomware attack on vendor Marquis Software Solutions has led to a major supply chain data breach, exposing sensitive customer data from dozens of U.S. banks and credit unions.

Article Slug: marquis-software-supply-chain-breach-hits-dozens-of-us-banks

Published Date: Thu, 27 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 27 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 08 Dec 2025 12:00:00 GMT
